snippet: Gov. Terry McAuliffe vetoed a bill Monday that would force schools to warn parents if their children will be assigned books with sexually explicit content.
abstract: Virginia Gov Terry McAuliffe vetoes bill backed by Republican-controlled House that would require schools to alert parents if their children will be assigned books with sexually explicit content.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Terry McAuliffe vetoed a bill Monday that would force schools to warn parents if their children will be assigned books with sexually explicit content.

headline.main: Virginia: Warning on School Books Is Vetoed
headline.print_headline: Virginia: Warning on Schoolbooks Is Vetoed
